item.title: Optimization
item.description: Whether you’re driven by ethics or the almighty dollar, great web performance is a must. Today we’ll start learning how to deliver high-performance web applications, and the impact performance has on search engine optimization. We’ll see how we can measure performance in the browser dev tools, and start by looking at the biggest opportunity for performance boosts: images.

item.title: Design & Development Workflow
item.description: Today we learn about the lifecycle of a web-based project. We’ll look at all the possible stages of a project, whether big or small.

item.title: Layout Part 2: Responsive workflow
item.description: Today we’ll build a responsive web page using flexbox.

item.title: CSS Layout Part 1
item.description: This week we’ll learn about mobile-first design techniques & media queries; how HTML flows by default, positioning in CSS, and the float property.

item.title: CSS Intro Part 2
item.description: Today we’ll get to practice our CSS (and learn a few more tricks) by building a menu. We’ll get an introduction to browser dev tools, a basic CSS reset, fonts in CSS, and how to style a menu with :pseudo selectors.

item.title: Introduction to CSS
item.description: Today we’ll look at what CSS is, how it operates, where to put it, how to write CSS rules, and how to validate our CSS.

item.title: Markup Pt 2: documents, semantics, layout
item.description: This week we’ll learn about all the components of a full HTML file, HTML5 semantic elements, accessibility, block/inline elements and more complex elements including ‘img’ and ‘table’.

item.title: Introduction / Markup Part 1: Content
item.description: Today we learn about the course, and take our first foray into Hypertext Markup Language.
